title: Things
text:
Here are some things..
For publications (there aren’t many) look on Google Scholar

For the last few years, most of my time has been spent on developing and teaching the various courses in quantitative methodology delivered in the Psychology department at the University of Edinburgh Psychology department.
All our course materials can be found at https://uoepsy.github.io
I took up painting a couple of years ago - there are photos of bits and pieces here
I have a dog - here he is
Want quick historical Scottish weather visualisations? See https://josiahpjking.shinyapps.io/scotweather
Previously, Ben Matthews and I spent a little while implementing Das Gupta’s standardisation and decomposition of rates in R, which you can find at https://github.com/josiahpjking/DasGuptR. We try our best to maintain it, but just file an issue/drop an email if you have any questions.
I’ve been involved in the development of various ShinyApps, including for the Scottish Crime and Justice Survey and for a researcher tool for counterfactual analysis.

title: Josiah King
text:
I am currently a lecturer in quantitative methods in psychology at the University of Edinburgh. I coordinate the teaching of undergraduate and postgraduate courses in statistics & quantitative methods using R and provide support to students and staff.
I have previously worked for the Scottish Centre for Administrative Data Research (SCADR), and for the Scottish Government. I completed my PhD in Psychology at the University of Edinburgh, studying nonverbal behaviour in relation to deception and cognitive load.
I am open to collaborations and PhD (co-)supervision on anything methods-y. You can contact me at josiah dot king @ed.ac.uk
